excerpt: Ouro Preto is a colonial town in the Serra do Espinhaço mountains of eastern Brazil. It’s known for its baroque architecture, including bridges, fountains and squares, and its steep, winding cobbled streets. Central Tiradentes Square is named after the martyr for Brazilian independence. There are numerous churches and chapels all over town, including the 18th-century St. Francis of Assisi Church.
detail_description: Ouro Preto, located in the Serra do Espinhaço mountains of eastern Brazil, is a charming colonial town renowned for its baroque architecture and picturesque cobblestone streets. The town features numerous bridges, fountains, and squares, with Central Tiradentes Square being a notable landmark. Ouro Preto is also home to several 18th-century churches and chapels, including the iconic St. Francis of Assisi Church.
name: Ouro Preto
address: State of Minas Gerais, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Long-running museum dedicated to the casualties of a failed rebellion against Portugal in 1789.
detail_description: Museu da Inconfidência is a long-standing museum housed in the former municipal headquarters and old jail of Ouro Preto, dating back to 1784-1854. It pays tribute to the victims of the failed Inconfidencia Mineira movement, which sought independence from Portugal in 1789. The museum features exhibits such as Tiradentes' tomb and manuscripts related to the revolt.
name: Museu da Inconfidência
address: Praça Tiradentes, 139 - Centro Histórico, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Praça Tiradentes in Ouro Preto is a bustling square located at the heart of the town. Named after Tiradentes, a prominent figure in Brazilian history, this square is adorned with two striking monuments at its opposite ends. The surrounding area offers an inviting selection of shops and cafes, making it a perfect spot to immerse yourself in the local culture.
name: Praça Tiradentes - Ouro Preto
address: MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Cemitério da Ordem Terceira de São Francisco de Assis is located next to the Church of St. Francis of Assisi in Ouro Preto, designed by Aleijadinho. This cemetery was built near churches due to the ban on burying the dead inside them during colonial times. It is a place where only white and wealthy people from that era were buried, reflecting the respect for the deceased at that time.
name: Cemitério da Ordem Terceira de São Francisco de Assis
address: Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Museu Casa Guignard, established in 1987, is a tribute to Alberto da Veiga Guignard, a prominent Brazilian painter and designer of the 20th century. The museum takes visitors on a journey through Guignard's life, showcasing his artistic masterpieces and personal story. With three rooms dedicated to permanent exhibitions, the museum displays Guignard's paintings that reflect his deep affection for Brazil's landscapes, particularly Ouro Preto.
name: Museu Casa Guignard
address: Rua Conde de Bobadela, 110 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Revered Catholic church with a gold-plated, painted interior, plus displays of religious artifacts.
detail_description: Basílica Nossa Senhora do Pilar is a revered Catholic church located in Ouro Preto, Brazil. The church boasts a richly decorated interior covered with 400 pounds of gold and silver leaf. It features gold- and silver-clad sculptures, paintings by Bernardo Pires, and two massive angels made of solid silver.
name: Basílica Nossa Senhora do Pilar
address: Praça Monsenhor Castilho Barbosa, 17 - Pilar, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The Igreja de Nossa Senhora do Carmo, completed in 1776, showcases the final works of renowned Brazilian sculptor Aleijadinho. Originally designed by Aleijadinho's father and later enhanced by the artist himself, this church features rococo elements and soapstone sculptures of angels above its entrance. Frequented by Ouro Preto's high society when inaugurated, it also houses the only examples of decorative Portuguese tiles from that period in Minas Gerais.
name: Igreja de Nossa Senhora do Carmo
address: R. Costa Sena, 289 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Mountain park with hiking trails, campgrounds & historic sites, plus a visitor's center & museum.
detail_description: Itacolomi State Park, located near Ouro Preto, offers a diverse range of natural and historical attractions. The park features the prominent Pico do Itacolomi, standing at 1,772 meters and serving as a significant landmark for former travelers. Visitors can explore various trails such as the chapel, lagoon, and oven trails while also visiting the dam and Mirante do Custodio.
name: Itacolomi State Park
address: BR-356, Km 98 - Bauxita, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: 18th-century Roman Catholic church known for its design & lavishly painted interior.
detail_description: The Church of Saint Francis of Assisi is an 18th-century Roman Catholic church renowned for its exquisite design and lavishly painted interior. Constructed in 1768 by the celebrated Baroque artist Aleijadinho, it stands as one of Ouro Preto's most iconic architectural landmarks.
name: Church of Saint Francis of Assisi
address: Largo de Coimbra, s/n - Centro, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Mina Du Veloso is a former gold mine featuring a 400-meter underground chamber supported by pillars. Visitors are guided through the mine to learn about Brazil's gold mining history, the techniques used by enslaved Africans, and the miners' daily lives and customs. Tours are available in Portuguese and English. The experience offers an insightful look into the reality of working in an old gold mine, with guides providing historical and geological information.
name: Mina Du Veloso
address: R. Levindo Inácio André, 400 - São Cristóvão, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The Igreja de Nossa Senhora das Mercês e Perdões, also known as the Church of Merces de Baixo, is a beautiful colonial church located in Ouro Preto. Situated on top of a small hill and surrounded by steps leading to its entrance, this church was originally completed in 1772 and later rebuilt in the mid-19th century.
name: Igreja da Venerável Ordem Terceira de Nossa Senhora das Mercês e Perdões
address: Largo Musicista José dos Anjos Costa, 1 - 91, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled within the Federal University of Ouro Preto, the Museu da Farmácia is a captivating destination for anyone interested in the evolution of pharmacy and medicine from the 19th to 20th centuries. This museum showcases an impressive collection that includes preserved archives with notes from both local and European origins, alongside historical medical equipment and various medicines dating back to the 18th century.
name: Museu da Farmácia - UFOP
address: R. Costa Sena, 171 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Ouro Preto, the Igreja do Senhor Bom Jesus de Matosinhos e São Miguel e Almas is a captivating blend of history and artistry. This church, with its origins tracing back to around 1763 during the gold rush era, features an impressive portico crafted by Aleijadinho that dramatically depicts Saint Michael battling against the fires of hell, surrounded by souls from purgatory.
name: Igreja do Senhor Bom Jesus de Matosinhos e São Miguel e Almas
address: R. Alvarenga, 513 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

excerpt: Traditional dishes & homemade desserts are offered in this rustic venue set in a historic building.
detail_description: Restaurante Contos de Réis is a charming dining spot located in a historic building, offering traditional dishes and homemade desserts. Situated in the rustic charm of Ouro Preto, this restaurant provides a captivating culinary experience that delves into Brazil's rich heritage. The menu features skillfully prepared local specialties such as Local Sausage with Jilo and Braised Beef Ribs served with savory farofa and fried polenta, showcasing the essence of Minas Gerais cuisine.
name: Restaurante Contos de Réis
address: R. Camillo de Brito, 21 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: If you're a cinema enthusiast visiting Ouro Preto, make sure to stop by Cinema Villa Rica Ouro Preto / UFOP. This charming venue is currently the only cinema in town and boasts a unique historical ambiance that adds character to your movie-watching experience. While it primarily screens films, it also hosts theater performances and various events for seated audiences, making it a cultural hub worth exploring. The location is quite convenient—especially if you happen to catch a bus nearby!
name: Cinema Villa Rica Ouro Preto / UFOP
address: R. Antônio Pereira, 3 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: Exploring the Centro Histórico of Ouro Preto is akin to stepping back in time to the late 1700s and early 1800s, a period rich in Portuguese colonial history. This charming old town features cobblestone streets, stunning baroque churches, and beautifully preserved mansions that reflect its cultural heritage. A walking tour here can be moderately challenging due to elevation changes and uneven paths but offers an immersive experience near key attractions, including seven magnificent churches.
name: Centro Histórico - Ouro Preto
address: Praça Tiradentes - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: R. São Francisco de Assis - Ouro Preto is a charming city with several notable churches, including the beautiful Igreja do Carmo in the city center, offering stunning views; the richly adorned Basilica of Pilar; and the masterpiece of baroque architecture, Igreja de São Francisco de Assis, featuring paintings by Mestre Athayde and carvings by Aleijadinho.
name: R. São Francisco de Assis - Ouro Preto
address: MG, 35400-135, Brazil

excerpt: Forested park featuring several waterfalls & natural pools, plus a restaurant, BBQs & horse rides.
name: Parque Cachoeira das Andorinhas
address: Córrego José Pedro - Vale das Hortênsias, Alto Jequitibá - MG, 36976-000, Brazil

detail_description: Minas do Palácio Velho stands as a testament to the rich and often somber history of gold mining in Minas Gerais, particularly during the 18th century. Nestled at the foot of Tapanhuacanga Hill, this site offers visitors a glimpse into the original techniques used for gold extraction in Ouro Preto. Unlike more adventurous mines, this location emphasizes its historical significance.
name: Minas Do Palácio Velho
address: R. Dom Silvério, 159 - Ouro Preto, MG, 35400-000, Brazil

detail_description: The serene cascade of Waterfall 3 Drops offers a tranquil ambiance that soothes the senses. Its melodious tunes have an enchanting effect, rejuvenating one's inner being. This captivating tourist destination showcases nature's beauty in its purest form, with water gently descending in a harmonious rhythm. As visitors admire the breathtaking sight, they can't help but be captivated by its magnificence and allure.
name: Waterfall 3 Drops
address: Lavras Novas, Ouro Preto - MG, 35400-000, Brazil
